data.text: When a young scientist is accused of heresy for trying to save sentient life from extinction by reintroducing extinct pollinators, revolution erupts in all directions.
data.title: jsp.architecture.thumbnail.premise.title
data.subtitle: jsp.architecture.thumbnail.premise.description

data.description:
Strand Name: The Legends of Massachawa

Act: I

Chapters or Scenes:

  1. Leaving Selaron
  2. Charting a Mobal Vessel
  3. Stories Told on the Krbsh Sea
  4. Picking up travelers in the Settan Delta
  5. Stories Told on the River Pavan
  6. Meeting Monmar Massachawa
  7. Her story of Harmonies Sung in the Light of the Moons
  8. Arriving in Morilly, stories re-told and overheard
  9. Negotiations in Morilly


Main Conflict(s)

Monmar Massachawa's Fifth Circle bitamin group, who may (or may not) be acting on behalf of the House of the Empafarasi, outbid the various Kahila-based bitamin groups for both licit and illicit goods (drugs, spices, seeds, roots, weapons, armor) at the auction in Morilly.

The name "Fifth Circle" is challenge to the traditional Four Families of the Bitamin, the 4 major criminal-ish syndicates that operate out of the Kahilakol and have a widespread network in the Kahila Lands and Outer Lands.


Main Events, Resolutions, Actions

  • The auction features the Mobal Beshqi controllers and a slew of traders, including some who claims to have come from the Komikon, from the Remarii Islands, and from Lewshanana. Others claims to have traded directly with the Krbshanana. 
  • The bidding war between the bitamin groups is fast and angry, with much moving about in the shadows.
  • The arrival of Monmar Massachawa sends a shock through the assemblage.
  • We learn that she is Mikel Moballeq's partner -- and Ramona's adoptive mother.


Location(s)

  • Selaron
  • at sea on the Krbsh
  • the coast of Mobalbesq
  • the Peaceful Delta of the Settan
  • on a boat going up the Settan
  • Morilly

And via tales told:

  • Juuj, particularly the Dark Pool
  • the hill country between High Weir and Low Weir
  • Barbol



Point of View/Narrator(s)

This section is all told in the form of Ramona's letters to her contacts. 


Actors

  • Mikel Moballeq
  • Ramona
  • Monmar Massachawa
  • Kirill Gekster
  • various bitamin characters
  • various traders
  • able seamen
  • river seamen
  • Mobal Beshqi militia
  • some jaxen


Timeline(s)

This follows after strands: 005, 006 - Traveling to Selaron after the events in Ríkila.

This precedes strands: 010 Terafina's Mediation

Rough Dates / Duration:

About 10 days. Travel is about 600 km, first at sea and then going upriver, much of that through a huge swampy Delta.


If Flashback, how far?:

- The story of Harmonies Sung in the Light of the Moon, told to Ramona by Monmar Massachawa, takes place in the High Weir Lands about 6 months prior 

- A number of the stories about Massachawa, about the Kahila, about the Dark Pool of Juuj, take place at various times in the past two years.

- The actual movement in this section follows the "real time" story arc timeline 



Beauty

Monmar Massachawa has a dark, bold, troubled, transgressive beauty that makes the otherness of the kahila-folk pale in comparison. Her story about going to the Dark Pool at Juuj describes her diving in naked and swimming without fear; how it made her feel like she was flying.


Humor

The legends of Massachawa are called "delicious" because they always hint at mysteries, some dreadful, some wonderful, hidden just around the corner. Wolf-sints. Tree-sints. Strange and dangerous beings who live below ground in the faraway Krunkinotto Mountains. Secret entrances to ancient places.


Truth

Can there be honor among thieves? What does it really mean to be transgressive, to be free? Is it enough to be organized, to defend one's clan or family? What does it mean to live one's own life?


Impact (emotional, aesthetic, intellectual)

Cinematic tritones. The rumbling of yin-water accumulating a great quantity of qi that is getting ready to turn to yang-fire steam. Coming to a boil. Heating up the forge.  Storm gathering.
data.name: 008 The Legends of Massachawa

data.description:
Strand Name: Terafina's Mediation

Act: I

Chapters:

  1. Negotiation between Maatsuuv and Malvorra
  2. Origin of the love affair between Allane and Kaharan
  3. Marriage settlements feast in Wildwind


Scenes:

  • Leaving the auction in Selaron by sea
  • Traveling along the Krbsh coastlines of Mobalbesq and Ny
  • Transferring to smaller vessels at the Great Marsh
  • Traveling along the Arql coastline of Ny
  • Arriving in Morilly
  • Preparations for the Wedding Feast
  • Arrival of Untamed and Terrapin invitees from the west 
  • Discussions between Ramona and Malvorra
  • Discussions between Maatsuuv and Malvorra
  • Arguments, questions from the Untamed factions
  • Ramona tells the story of Allane and Kaharan
  • Terafina meets with Snek
  • Terafina mediates between the southern groups
  • They attend the wedding feast as guests
  • Marriage competitions are announced
  • Dance combats continue into the night


Main Conflict(s)


Disagreements between the Dauni Vakasaqua, Untamed and Terrapin communities and factions over whether, or to what extent, to support Stanley's argument and/or to intervene in his favor. Terafina mediates between them.


Similar discussions, debates among the Ny Clans, but focusing more on whether to aid in the defense of Sungyte and Eibar.


Main Events, Resolutions, Actions

  • Respecting boundaries between the southern communities, dropping hints about deeper and more interesting divisions within factions, sub-groups within the communities


  • Marriages are arranged and settled in the Ny Lands through a kind of dance-combat


  • Ny Clan fighters pledge to fight the invaders from Ilyushan


Location(s)

  • Selaron
  • The Mobalbesq coast
  • The Ny coast
  • The Krbsh Sea near the coasts
  • The Settan River Delta between Ny and Mobalbesq
  • The Great Marsh and Lake Arql
  • Wildwind (formerly known as Wye)

And by the telling of a story:

  • Barbol
  • Heliohlan


Point of View/Narrator(s)

  • In her capacity as a special agent for the Traveling Sisters and an adept of the Academy, Ramona frequently posts letters to contacts in both groups. She also frequently writes to Stan, Showan and Mikel.  
  • The chapters told from Ramona's perspective consist of letters written to various characters. (The Riders are, of course, the Pony Express along with everything else they do.) 


Actors

  • Ramona
  • Terafina
  • Maatsuuv
  • Malborra
  • Snek
  • able seamen
  • Rider couriers
  • Ny clan/family leaders and elders
  • Newly-announced or proposed Ny couples 
  • Those supporting/opposing the matches
  • Other guests


Timeline

After: 007 Breaking the Rules, the auction in Selaron

Before:


Rough Dates / Duration:

   It is a journey of somewhat more than 600 km, mostly by sea.

At roughly 8.33 km/hour, that is ~ 74 hour (3+ days) journey.

And they change ships at the Great Marsh, proceeding more slowly. So let's say 5 days of travel, 2 or 3 days of meetings before the feast, the feast lasts 2 days. So like 10 days altogether.


If Flashback, how far?:

- Ramona tells the of events regarding Allane and Kaharan that occurred over a month ago

- otherwise, we are in "real time", i.e., in the main story arc


Beauty

The coastlines, gazing out into the seas, the Peaceful Delta, wonders of the Krbsh Sea, the Great Marsh and the Arql Sea.


Humor

Dance-humor. Echo a small smack-down from the first/opening narrative strand. When folks are dancing at the Full Moons in Ríkila, a stiff-formal very traditional form of dance-fighting was performed, observed in seriousness. This time it is a laugh-out-loud mass rumble where folks are hooting and hollering.


Truth

To make a commitment to help others is no small matter. This is reinforced in the meeting between Terafina and Snek.


Impact (emotional, aesthetic, intellectual)

The old serpent speaks evenly and slowly, on much the same wavelength as the ancient turtle.  She asks for his views on heavenly love, the kind where one strives to be service to a community, perhaps even of service to an abstracted community -- and earthly love, the kind where beks are committed directly to one another.

He urges patience in these matters, as in all others. He gazes seaward. She notices this.
data.name: 010 Terafina's Mediation

data.name: 042 Unfathomable

data.description:
Strand Name: Trees Are Growing

Act: III


Chapters or Scenes:

  1.  Snek ruminates
  2.  Replay the arrival on Wing Island
  3.  The whale-firebird
  4.  A great tree
  5.  The green traveler


Main Conflict(s)

The new technology, the miracle of flying pollinating species, also arises from a deep, dark pool. 

A pollination of new ideas, an expansion of sharing and compassion, triggers internal evolution.

She who travels across the stars is baffled by it and departs; her own sense of certainty and power challenged, she retreats to a forest of stars, closer to the galactic center.

Snek, so close to Nature, had anticipated not only the release of the flying creatures, but the rising of the great, dark enigma. But even Snek cannot describe its nature.


Main Events, Resolutions, Actions

The bees, birds and bugs pour out of Wing Island. The jars were only a token of what is to come. 

Trees grow rapidly all over the island.  One, at the place where the jars were removed, is huge, sending out massive roots, reaching up to the sky, tearing things up.  It is sentient and speaks with Snek, who is there.

Most of the birds are not sentient. A few avionic sints are among them. As they soar towards the Saskan Lands, they speak amongst themselves of the awakening of the great force, of sea and sky, water and wind, of ice and fire, of metal and wood and dirt, of magnetic waves, in a way unfamiliar to huum and most mammal conversation.

Behind their wave the ocean churns. A whale the size of the largest town arises and transforms, becoming a firebird, a dragon, a phoenix, flying high above the clouds. It then that the Green Lady departs. 

The perception of the tree-sints, of the bird-sints, of Snek can barely conceive of it. They would need to forget their civilization, their knowledge of the way things are, to even begin to grasp it. Even Snek cannot describe its nature.

Snek gets a ride back to the Saskan Lands from a raven-sint, who drops him off at Juuj.


Snek observes a deep rumble arising from the Dark Pool at Juuj when a vast cloud passes over the lands, with a strong wind.



Location(s)

  • Wing Island
  • Juuj


Point of View/Narrator(s)


This chapter is taken from the Book of Snek.



Actors

  • Snek
  • She Who Travels Across the Stars
  • various bird-sints and tree-sints
  • a bunch of birds, bees, insects
  • some Elders of Juuj


Timeline(s)

This strand follows after: everything else, but also from the departure of the expedition from Wing Island

What strands occurs after this one: None. this is the end of the story.

Rough Dates and/or Duration:

3-5 days maybe. Need to figure out how fast a raven carrying a snake can fly about 1400 km.

If Flashback, how far?:

Beauty


Humor


Truth


Impact (emotional, aesthetic, intellectual)
data.name: 044 Trees Are Growing

data.description:
Name of Location: Khaliro

Type of Location: Old Fatunik River Town

Role in Story


Khaliro is the largest town and an important citadel in the Khalo province, which is a major agricultural and fishing area along the Pavan River, as well as a manufacturing and services hub for the Fatunik provinces between the two rivers.


With its proximity to Qurol, Pavol and Borded, it one of the most cosmopolitan of the Fatunik towns, despite its nearness also to the Center of Authority at Beshquohuk. 


Languages

Eibar is by far the dominant language, with only a few inflections distinguishing the traditional local accent from 'proper' Old Eibar.

Given the town's prominent place on the river Pavan, many visitors pass through via river traffic. Those from the West are mostly from Qurol, Borded and Mabhakol, with the occasional Eelani and other westerners. 

Those going up river from the east are usually Eibar-speaking Fatunik traders, with a smattering of Outerlanders speaking Sogomsh. 


Demographics

Khaliro is cosmopolitan in the sense that it has a small permanent Rider population of non-believers, as well as some immigrants from the Outerlands, whose devotion to the Fatunik Dominion is well know to be less than strong.

There are also regular visitors from the Dauni Vakasaqua farming collectives south of the Settan, who regularly come to share knowledge, trade seeds and roots, and advise on agricultural matters.

The Town Authority prides itself on being civil and hospitable to these populations, though it keeps a close eye on them and requires them to reside in specific sections of the town.

Like all Fatunik towns south of the Pavan, non-huum sints are not permitted to reside in the town except in cases where they are registered to work as servants, just as they can work as farmhands in the surrounding countryside.

There is a substantially larger class of wealthy huum in Khaliro, as opposed to many other Fatunik towns. They have leading positions in the Fatunik guilds and/or come from old, wealthy and influential broods, or are high-ranking Scribes, Candle-makers or other high-ranking Tagabant who, due to their status, dress fancifully and present their gender openly. This makes Khaliro quite distinctive.  The rich also tend to take on rabbit-sints as servants.


History

One of the oldest Fatunik towns, Khaliro was a critical original fortification protecting Fatunik settlements south of the Pavan and east of the Borda Woods. Its oldest construction sites date back almost 3,700 turns. Parts of its walls are over 2,000 turns old.

Khaliro was founded 1,000 turns before Pavol. 

It is credited with being the bastion of Fatunik huum forces during the Great Eelani War, which concluded about 1,200 years ago with the defeat of the Eelani and the demarcation of the provincial borders between Fatunik and Rider-affiliated domains. 


Physical, Economic and/or Cultural Details

Thematic Tones / Feelings of the Place


Among the large Dominion towns, only Juuj and Eibar are older than Khaliro and only Beshquohuk is larger than Khaliro. It is about the same size as Borded. 

One feels the antiquity of the town around every corner. The stones are deeply worn and smoothed. Not an inch of the town is undeveloped or undecorated. Every building and street melds into the next.

The walls of Khaliro are legendary. They have withstood countless assaults from Wesshewen raiders -- and others -- over more than two millennia. During the Great Eelani War, the westerners were never able to breach them.

Enormously thick, the walls of Khaliro have been expanded and reinforced time after time. They contain a fearsome armory within their cavernous mazes. 

The deep tympanic rumblings of movements within the walls add to the mystique of Khaliro. Artistic depictions of its walls, or use of the Eibar rune for "Kh" are popular motifs throughout the Dominion for Tagabant units.

To be as strong, as undefeated, as solid as Khaliro is a standard Fatunik meme.

In each scene, ask:

- Did something funny happen? Or at least something fun?

- Is its goal clear?

- Was a truth told?

- Do I care? How so? Emotionally? Aesthetically? Intellectually?
